content: Of note, amiodarone is associated with safety concerns such as hemodynamic instability, sinus bradycardia, and QT interval prolongation compared to placebo.4., 5., 6., 7. There is also the issue of amiodarone-induced pulmonary toxicity and hepatitis as dreaded and anticipated problems despite their low estimated overall risks of 2% and 3%, respectively.8 Despite this, the PAPABEAR trial found no evidence of an association between excessive sinus bradycardia, hemodynamic deterioration, and adult respiratory distress syndrome following short-term amiodarone therapy when used as POAF prophylaxis.9

title: Combination prophylactic amiodarone with beta-blockers versus beta-blockers in atrial fibrillation after cardiac surgery: A systematic-review and meta-analysis
